item.title: Report E-2025030342
item.description:
Report E-2025030342

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 21, 2025, one (1) 15-gallon drum of mango extract was punctured by a nail and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025030388
item.description:
Report E-2025030388

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:15 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (BCO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 1 cup of Naphtha (hazardous - UN1268) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the box container and did not impact the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and damaged can with box will be placed into a 5-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release.

item.title: Report E-2025030054
item.description:
Report E-2025030054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 41500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02/26/2025, at 16:34 hours, personnel in the CSXT Yard in Walbridge, OH, discovered UTLX209767, a residue tank car of Ethyl Acrylate, emitting a strong odor. The car was isolated and the shipper, Zeon Chemicals, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-02-26-0146). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the car was actively releasing product vapors from the liquid line reducer bushing threads, vapor line reducer bushing threads, and vacuum relief valve (VRV). Contractor personnel applied thread tape and thread dope to secure the liquid line and vapor line bushing releases. Additionally, emergency containment measures were taken to reduce the odor/vapor emissions from the vacuum relief valve. Subsequently, additional contractor personnel were mobilized to safely depressurize the car, remove the faulty VRV, and install a blind flange to ensure the car was leak tight. The issue was identified, and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Sharen Panday (sharen.panday@us.sasol.com). The car was released for transport home shop under shipper OMTA.

item.title: Report E-2025030321
item.description:
Report E-2025030321

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-21
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2357 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at the terminal BCO. It was reported that a 25-gallon “Octave” UN3264 was released from a 55-gallon DF. The release impacted the trailer floor. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of UN3264 Octave product released to a 15’x8’ area of the trailer floor due to load shifting during transit and puncturing drum. The contactors neutralized the material with sodium bicarbonate and solidifying the release with oil dri. The waste generated was containerized into (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025030359
item.description:
Report E-2025030359

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ESTES personnel observed half a gallon of material spilled from one (1) 269-gallon IBC metal tote. There was a crack at the elbow on the valve. This was a shipper failure. They requested a contractor to be dispatched and help with a tote transfer. However, the request was later requested. The shipper attempted to repair and reuse the tote. The ESTES terminal personnel will handle the spill going forward.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-25T18:19:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 20, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon jugs of UN3098 were punctured and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew neutralized the materials and collected the spent product with hand tools. All impacted materials and the damaged jugs were containerized in five (5) 35-gallon drums.
